questions.question_text: What are two characteristics of the internet service database (ISDB) in an SD-WAN rule? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A. Dynamically updated & reduces overhead → Fortinet maintains an Internet Service Database (ISDB) that is regularly updated with the latest IP addresses and services. This reduces the need for manual configuration.
B. Contains IPs and port ranges → The ISDB includes a database of public services such as Microsoft 365, AWS, Google Cloud, etc., along with their associated IPs and ports.
A & B - Study Guide Page 183

Selected Answer: AB
A & B are correct - see page 185 in the 7.2 Study guide

choices.D: The ISDB requires application control to maintain signatures and perform load balancing.
choices.B: The ISDB contains the IP addresses and port ranges of well-known internet services.
choices.C: The ISDB applies rules to traffic from specific sources, based on application type.
choices.A: The ISDB is dynamically updated and reduces administrative overhead.

questions.question_text: Which SD-WAN setting enables FortiGate to delay the recovery of ADVPN shortcuts?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Hold-down time is a setting in SD-WAN that prevents premature failover of ADVPN (Auto-Discovery VPN) shortcuts.
When a shortcut tunnel goes down, FortiGate waits for the hold-down time before attempting recovery.
This helps prevent flapping (frequent switching between paths).

Selected Answer: D
D page 285

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. Explained on page 286 in the study guide.

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D : Check the Fortinet max value table https://docs.fortinet.com/max-value-table look for value : system.sdwan:members that is maxed at 512 members.

Selected Answer: D
D, Si hasta 512 se puede por sona y podes dejar la zona sin miembros dentro de ella.
Correct answer is A: a zone must contain at least one member, answer D is misleading

Selected Answer: D
D: pmorin is right

Selected Answer: D
I THINK D is correct, however I am not able to find any information regarding this, except that in this doc - https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.4.5/administration-guide/19246/sd-wan it is mentioned that a maximim of 255 members can be placed in an SD-WAN zone. So for 7.2 this might have been increased to 512. As far as I can tell, none of this information is detailed in the study guide. B & C are definitely wrong though.

questions.question_text: Which statement about SD-WAN zones is true?

choices.D: An SD-WAN zone can contain between 0 and 512 members.
choices.A: You can configure up to 32 SD-WAN zones per VDOM.
choices.B: You cannot use an SD-WAN zone in static route definitions.
choices.C: An SD-WAN zone can contain only one type of interface.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
C. ✅ Correct – A template group can contain both per-device and per-scope CLI templates, allowing different configurations to be applied.
D. ✅ Correct – A template group can include both a system template and an SD-WAN template, enabling centralized configuration management.
E. ✅ Correct – CLI templates in a template group are processed in a top-down order, ensuring sequential application of configurations.

Selected Answer: CDE
A. wrong
B. wrong types are cli or jinja and not perl
C. Correct page 53 - Can mix both types in template group
D. Correct - That is mentioned aleady truserud
E. Correct - The template groups can
contain a mix of CLI and Jinja scripts and are applied in a top-down order.

Selected Answer: CDE
CDE Correct answers

Selected Answer: CDE
A) False. Page 54: You can use a template group to assign multiple CLI scripts to managed devices

B) False. Page 54: On FortiManager you can create two types of scripts: CLI scripts and Jinja scripts.

C) Correct. Page 54: The template groups can contain a mix of CLI and Jinja scripts

D) Correct. https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortimanager/7.2.5/administration-guide/316120/template-groups

E) Correct. Page 54: and are applied in a top-down order.

Selected Answer: CDE
C,D,E is correct

Selected Answer: CDE
C D & E are correct. 
C & E are detailed on page 54 in the 7.2 Study Guide. 
D is detailed here - https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortimanager/7.2.5/administration-guide/316120/template-groups

You can assign one provisioning template from each of the following template types to a template group. Multiple AP profiles can be selected.

 System template
 ...
 SD-WAN template

BDE are the correct answer Study Guide page 54. B. A CLI template can be of type CLI script or Perl script.
D. A template group can include a system template and an SD-WAN template.
E. CLI templates are applied in order, from top to bottom.

Option A is incorrect because you can apply both a system template and a CLI template to the same FortiGate device. Therefore, options B, D, and E are the correct characteristics of provisioning templates on FortiManager.

questions.question_text: Which three characteristics apply to provisioning templates available on FortiManager? (Choose three.)

choices.A: You cannot apply a system template and CLI template to the same FortiGate device.
choices.C: A CLI template group can contain CLI templates of both types.
choices.B: A CLI template can be of type CLI script or Perl script.
choices.D: A template group can include a system template and an SD-WAN template.
choices.E: CLI templates are applied in order, from top to bottom.

questions.question_text: What are two benefits of using CLI templates in FortiManager? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B & D as explained from truserud

Selected Answer: BD
B & D are correct. Described on page 53 in the 7.2 Study Guide

choices.C: You can configure interfaces as SD-WAN members without having to remove references first.
choices.B: You can configure advanced CLI settings.
choices.A: You can configure FortiManager to sync local configuration changes made on the managed device, to the CLI template.
